title: The Poet and the Murderer: A True Story of Literary Crime and the Art of Forgery
description: A renowned journalist delves into the deeply disturbed mind of Mark Hofmann, one of the most daring literary forgers and merciless killers of the late twentieth century, whose greatest deception was a forged Emily Dickinson poem, which led to fame and fortune, forcing him to commit atrocious crimes in order to keep his forgery a secret. 20,000 first printing.
author: Simon Worrall
